Ok is persist kicker or horsemanship?

comments_since_last_sample.body: when I saw cleave my mind went immediately to this. It is literally just kicker renamed in a slightly different style.
This and who's the Commander for the Simic Value engine deck =it doesn't matter......two points hes 100% correct on

Flashback isn't kicker because you don't have to pay the flashback cost when you cast the spell from your hand. Phyrexian mana isn't kicker because it's an alternate cost, not an additional cost. Flanking, Landwalk and Banding aren't horsemanship because they don't rely on creatures having the same ability to determine ability to block. Also, horsemanship is flying because flying came out first.
I raise you cost reduction effects like spectacle, and check effects like delerium. Also effects that dont use costs nor add evasion; like rampage, banding, and bushido.
Ok is persist kicker or horsemanship?

Honestly this is about right though. Magic the gathering, for all it's complexity, can be boiled down to a few very simple effects that are repeated with different keywords. There are nuances of course, but those aren't really needed unless you recklessly dive straight into competitive formats first thing.
Mark Rosewater's podcast has an episode on this. Its true though.
Seems like Annihilator, Bushido, Soulbond, Infect etc. - it's a new kind of Horsemanship XD
...I feel I have been lied to my whole life.  Thanks
The one mechanic  I hate the most is kicker Because  its TOO expensive!
